title: Strictly's David James and pro partner Nadiya Bychkova put on a cosy display
text:
They became the fourth dance couple to be sent packing on this year's Strictly Come Dancing last week.

But David James and his professional partner Nadiya Bychkova proved their bond is still strong as they gave each other a friendly kiss goodbye after leaving It Takes Two on Monday.

David, 49, and Nadiya, 30, both stunned in their respective outfits as they embraced warmly following their TV appearance.

Warm: David James and his professional partner Nadiya Bychkova still put on another cosy display as they gave each other a friendly kiss after leaving It Takes Two

Nadiya rocked a tight red dress and nude heels, with her golden tresses flowing in loose curls.

And David impressed in a maroon suit and Nike trainers, having changed into a white shirt instead of a Superman T-shirt that he had arrived in earlier.

In the endearing snaps, the pair showed off their warm friendship, with David's arm placed firmly around Nadiya as they embraced.

At one point she seemed to be beckoning him to come closer as David walked a few steps behind.

Heart-warming: In the endearing snaps, the pair showed off their warm friendship, with David's arm placed firmly around Nadiya as they embraced

The footballer gave the blonde beauty a kiss on the cheek and Nadiya was later seen laughing as the dancing pair said goodbye to each other.

Nadiya then showcased her sense of style and lean pins in full as she walked away, leaving the star to get into his waiting car.

David had earlier arrived for the spin off show with in the same outfit but with a casual baseball cap and a superhero T-shirt.

Affection: David, 49, and Nadiya, 30, both stunned in their respective outfits as they embraced warmly following their TV appearance

Enjoying the company: David and Nadiya looked at home together as they walked in London in front of fans

Also arriving for the show was professional dancer Karen Clifton, 36, who split from her Strictly co-star husband Kevin Clifton, 36, last year.

The star showed off a bright blue suit and smart silver heels.

She was joined by her new boyfriend David Webb for the outing, with the pair looking smitten as they headed home.

Come here: At one point she seemed to be beckoning him to come closer as David walked a few steps behind

Look at me: Nadiya then showcased her sense of style and lean pins in full as she walked away, leaving the star to get into his waiting car

Radiant in red: Nadiya looked sensational in scarlet as she rocked her figure-hugging midi

On Sunday David became the fourth celebrity to be sent packing from the show.

The former goalkeeper and Nadiya faced off against Mike Bushell and Katya Jones in the dance off after receiving the lowest number of votes from the public.

Both couples vied to impress the judges by performing their routines again, but David and Nadiya's Jive to Such a Night by Michael Bublé failed to make a lasting impression.

Unstoppable: David had earlier arrived for the spin off show with in the same outfit but with a casual baseball cap and a Superman T-shirt

Delivering his verdict, Craig Revel Horwood said: 'Well for me both couples were pretty much technically equal but the couple who I’d like to save were the most confident performers and that was Mike And Katya.'

Motsi Mabuse also chose to save Mike and Katya, saying: 'Well I felt that one couple gave me a better performance than I saw the first time so I’m going to save Mike and Katya.'

Alfonso Ribeiro agreed: 'The couple who I’m going to save put on a great show.

'The technique wasn’t there but they came out and delivered a showstopper for the audience to love so I’m going to save Mike And Katya.'

It could be worse: David looked in high spirits despite his and Nadiya's exit from Strictly on Sunday

Head Judge Shirley Ballas said she would have also chosen to save Mike and Katy, explaining, 'Yes I would have saved Mike and Katya.'

When asked by Tess Daly about his time on the show, David said: 'Oh I’ve loved it. I feel so bad I’ve let Nadiya down in a sense. I’ve enjoyed it but I’ve put some weight on though.'

Discussing his highlights, David said: 'Having the best partner and the guys up there. Everyone’s lovely. Just a word to Will: I think I work hard, but, man, that guy puts a shift in.'

Me too: Also arriving for the show was professional dancer Karen Clifton, 36, who split from her Strictly co-star husband Kevin Clifton, 36, last year

Delightful duo: She was joined by her new boyfriend David Webb for the outing, with the pair looking smitten as they headed home

Committed: Dancer Katya Jones, 30, who recently split from her husband Neil, left It Takes Two still wearing her wedding and engagement rings

Happier times: The star looked to be in brighter spirits than in recent weeks, during which she has broken down in tears following performances with dance partner Mike Bushell

Nadiya was asked if she had any words for David and insisted she was incredibly proud of him.

She enthused: 'He’s done so well. I’m so proud of you. From the first day he couldn’t lift his elbows up or stand straight and now he’s delivered such an amazing jive. I’m so proud.'

Sunday’s Results show opened with a group performance and singer Mabel performing her sit single Don’t Call Me Up with professional dancers Dianne, Nancy, AJ and Gorka.
description: They became the fourth dance couple to be sent packing on this year's Strictly Come Dancing last week.  But David and his Nadiya proved their bond is still strong as they gave each other a friendly kiss.
